hadiths.english_translation: He is the nephew of al-Aswad ibn Yazid al-Nakha'i. He said: I heard Husayn ibn Ali al-Ju'fi saying: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Yazid was called Abu Ja'far, and he was called al-Kayyis (the clever one) for his cleverness in worship.

hadiths.english_translation: We are told that Muhammad ibn al-Fuday ibn Ghazwan [narrated] from his father, he said: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Yazid was called al-Maradi (the pleased one), and he was called al-Kayyis (the clever one), and he was called al-Rafiq (the gentle one).

hadiths.english_translation: We are told that Ali ibn Abdullah ibn Ja'far said: Sufyan said: Malik said: There was with Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Yazid a righteous woman - whatever befell her was only through supplication. Sufyan said: And he (Muhammad) was called al-Rafiq (the gentle one), and he was few in hadith narration.

hadiths.english_translation: And Wakee said: from al-A'mash: Yahya ibn Wathab, when he was in prayer, was as if he was addressing a man [addressing someone]. We are told by Ubayd Allah ibn Musa, he said: We were narrated to by al-A'mash, he said: I saw Yahya ibn Wathab praying in a mosque. He said: Yahya ibn Wathab died in Kufa in the year one hundred and three (AH), during the caliphate of Yazid ibn Abd al-Malik, and he was trustworthy, few in hadith, a master of the Quran.

narrators.name: Wakee
narrators.full_name: Wakee ibn al-Jarrah ibn Malik al-Ruasi
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: He said (narrative transmission)

narrators.name: al-A'mash
reliabilityIssues: mudallis - Category 2 (Al-A'mash is known for tadlis but generally accepted even with 'an)
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: From (al-A'mash is known for tadlis, but he is generally reliable and his 'an transmissions are often accepted)

chainIssues: First narrator (Wakee) uses qala (قَالَ) - indirect/narrative transmission
al-A'mash is a known mudallis (Category 2) who uses 'an, though he is generally reliable and his transmissions are often accepted

potential_issues.impact: al-A'mash is classified as Category 2 mudallis by Ibn Hajar. However, he is generally considered reliable, and in the second chain he uses the direct transmission term hadathana (حَدَّثَنَا), which mitigates concerns. In the first chain, he uses 'an, but given his reliability, this does not significantly affect acceptance.

potential_issues.issue: First chain uses qala (قَالَ) by Wakee

potential_issues.issue: Mawquf chains - not reaching the Prophet ﷺ
potential_issues.impact: Both chains are mawquf (stopped) - they are historical/biographical observations about Yahya ibn Wathab's character and death, not hadiths from the Prophet ﷺ.
